meanings.definition: Full of wiles; crafty or cunning.
meanings.sent1: The wily fox outsmarted the other animals in the forest.
meanings.sent2: She used her wily tactics to win the game.
meanings.sent3: The wily cat pretended to be asleep to catch the mouse by surprise.
meanings.sent4: His wily smile hid his true intentions.
meanings.sent5: The wily old wizard always had a trick up his sleeve.

meanings.sent1: The wily thief managed to steal the jewels without anyone noticing.
meanings.sent2: Her wily ways made it hard to trust her.
meanings.sent3: The wily magician made the audience believe he could fly.
meanings.sent4: His wily plan to escape from prison almost succeeded.
meanings.sent5: The wily politician knew how to manipulate the crowd.

meanings.sent1: The wily detective solved the case in record time.
meanings.sent2: She had a wily idea to get out of trouble.
meanings.sent3: The wily raccoon managed to steal food from the campers.
meanings.sent4: His wily negotiation skills always got him the best deals.
meanings.sent5: The wily inventor created a device that changed the world.
